info.title: Store API
info.description: Manage pet, order, purchase, user, and other pet store business operations.

get.description: Returns a pet by unique ID.

put.description: Update information for an existing pet.

delete.description: Delete a pet by unique ID.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key required for authorization (if any).

204.description: No content. The pet has been deleted and no other content is returned.

post.description: Add a new pet to the store.

get.description: Multiple status values can be provided as a comma-separated string.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Values to filter pet status (accepts comma-separated values).

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter results by tag (accepts comma-separated or repeated parameters).

post.description: Upload an image for the specified pet.

additionalMetadata.description: Additional data to pass to server

post.description: Payment is an attempt to pay for an order. After confirmation, the user can obtain their receipt.

get.description: Returns a mapping of status codes to quantities.

post.description: Create a new order in the store.

get.description: For a valid response, try integer IDs in the range 1-10. Other values will generate exceptions.

delete.description: For a valid response, try positive integer order IDs. Negative or non-integer values will cause an API error.

post.description: Handles order events and supports asynchronous processing with Callback.

callbackUrl.description: URL to call back when processing is complete

post.description: Create a new user in the system.

put.description: Only the logged-in user can perform this operation.

delete.description: Only the logged-in user can perform this operation.

get.description: User logs in and generates a session.

X-Expires-After.description: UTC date when the token expires

X-Rate-Limit.description: Number of calls allowed per hour for the user

get.description: Log out the current logged-in user.

post.description:
### Main Features

- **Free and Public:** No API key or authentication required.
- **GraphQL Schema:** Easily explore relationships between countries, continents, and languages.
- **Use Cases:** Test GraphQL clients, learn schemas, demos, etc.

---
### Instructions
In the 'success' debug environment for this endpoint, you can directly request the GraphQL API.
- Query fields are pre-filled.
- Click the refresh button next to 'Schema fetched' to fetch the schema.
- Click send to request and get a response.
---

### Endpoint

**GraphQL URL:**  
```
https://countries.trevorblades.com/
```

---

### Main Schema Objects

- **Country**
  - Fields: `code`, `name`, `native`, `phone`, `continent`, `capital`, `currency`, `languages`, `emoji`, etc.
  
- **Continent**
  - Fields: `code`, `name`, `countries`
  
- **Language**
  - Fields: `code`, `name`, `native`
  
---

### Example Queries

**Get all countries' code and name:**
```graphql
{
  countries {
    code
    name
  }
}
```

**Get details of a single country:**
```graphql
{
  country(code: "JP") {
    name
    capital
    currency
    languages {
      name
    }
  }
}
```

**List all continents and their countries:**
```graphql
{
  continents {
    name
    countries {
      name
      code
    }
  }
}
```

---

### How to Use

- You can use your own GraphQL client, curl, or visit [Countries API GraphQL Explorer](https://countries.trevorblades.com/) in your browser.
- Supports schema introspection; you can view the full schema and docs directly in GraphQL Playground.

---

### Common Use Cases

- **Frontend Prototyping:** For dropdown lists (countries, continents, etc.)
- **Demo Apps:** Populate selection options without a backend.
- **Learning GraphQL:** Practice queries and model navigation with real data.
An SSE connection will be automatically established when connecting to the server with the POST method. The server sends the current time every second.

Accepts two integers, returns their sum.
Service provided by DneOnline.

Pet.description: Animal information in the pet store.

status.description: Status of the pet in the store

id.description: Unique payment identifier. Used for linking to other objects.

amount.description: Payment amount. Positive decimal amount to be collected.

source.description: Payment source. Can be a bank card or bank account. Some properties are hidden for privacy.

oneOf.title: Bank Card
oneOf.description: Debit or credit card used for payment.

number.description: Card number string, no separators (masked when reading).

cvc.description: Card security code, usually three or four digits on the back.

address_country.description: Country of billing address (two-letter country code).

oneOf.title: Bank Account
oneOf.description: Bank account used for payment. Must support the payment currency.

sort_code.description: Sort code of the bank account (6-digit string).

bank_name.description: Bank name associated with the routing number.

status.description: Payment status: one of pending, succeeded, or failed.

petId.description: ID of the pet being ordered.

shipDate.description: Estimated shipping date for the order.

code.description: Application code returned in the response.

detail.example: The request is invalid or missing required parameters.

value.detail: The request is invalid or missing required parameters.

detail.example: You do not have the necessary permissions.

value.title: Unauthorized
value.detail: You do not have the necessary permissions.

detail.example: Access is forbidden with the provided credentials.

value.title: Forbidden
value.detail: Access is forbidden with the provided credentials.

detail.example: The specified resource does not exist.

value.title: Not Found
